item.title: Emote looping
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

bender4:

To asshole_rule, it certainly can’t be client-sided, it loops on the server, it’s not like the character bugs out, it’s just the same as if I were to do ::emote **, it loops the emote rather than doing once/twice

it’s client sided, lol.

that’s what happens when you load 602 stuff on a 317 client. you get bugs like this

Read full topic

item.title: Emote looping
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

bender4:

To asshole_rule, it certainly can’t be client-sided, it loops on the server, it’s not like the character bugs out, it’s just the same as if I were to do ::emote **, it loops the emote rather than doing once/twice

You do realise you explained the reason it can’t be client sided, is the actual reason it is client sided. If ::emote makes it repeat also, then it is not your code that does it. it is in the client’s animation cache to repeat then. (set up similar to the playerSE) which will loop, until replaced by another. I am sure there is something in the client that will let you force end an emote, but you has to find it. Or find someone who has examined the emote cache well.

Read full topic

item.title: Emote looping
item.dc:creator: @bender4 bender4
item.description:
@bender4 wrote:

Okay… so then I still don’t get why wouldn’t mine stop looping then…

item.title: Emote looping
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“bender4, post:4, topic:540453”]Well… this client doesn’t have wait timers, just action timers, and that wouldn’t really help. But, notice how the example code has: “pEmote = 0x850;” whereas the code that I used has: “pEmote = 2836;” Thing is, I just don’t see the relevance to 0x850 anywhere in the scripts.

To asshole_rule, it certainly can’t be client-sided, it loops on the server, it’s not like the character bugs out, it’s just the same as if I were to do ::emote **, it loops the emote rather than doing once/twice[/quote]Your emote ID is in hexadecimal form, no issue there and they don’t match because they point to different emotes.

Read full topic

Well… this client doesn’t have wait timers, just action timers, and that wouldn’t really help. But, notice how the example code has: “pEmote = 0x850;” whereas the code that I used has: “pEmote = 2836;” Thing is, I just don’t see the relevance to 0x850 anywhere in the scripts.

To asshole_rule, it certainly can’t be client-sided, it loops on the server, it’s not like the character bugs out, it’s just the same as if I were to do ::emote **, it loops the emote rather than doing once/twice

item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

It must be to do with how the animation update is sent, what is the “wait cycles” set to? The animation id seems right so I doubt that’s the issue.

item.title: Emote looping
item.dc:creator: @bender4 bender4
item.description:
@bender4 wrote:

Hey guys, just got a quick, maybe simple question? Working with a base server, should be pretty easy stuff, except I can’t seem to make my emotes stop looping when I make a new one.

Here’s the code:
case 59062:
// scared emote
if (emotes == 0) {
emotes = 1;
pEmote = 2836;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
} else {
emotes = 0;
pEmote = playerSE;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
break;

The server had 4 emotes that weren’t working, scared, bunny hop, etc., all the other emotes are working without looping, but when I added that one, it loops.

For example:

		case 52072:
			// goblin dance emote
			if (emotes == 0) {
				emotes = 1;
				pEmote = 0x850;
				updateRequired = true;
				appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
			} else {
				emotes = 0;
				pEmote = playerSE;
				updateRequired = true;
				appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
			}
			break;

Thanks!

Read full topic
